Reviews.Title: “Not very nice but cheap and well placed”
Reviews.Author: seasonedtraveller021
Reviews.Content: We stayed 5 nights at La Place because my husband was going to the cricket at Lords. The room was pretty grim, we are definitely used to better lodging, but we had decided to spend money on other thing than hotel so we went to the Opera, to see a show and to have fabulous food at Tom Aikens. I would not say that the hotel is dirty, it is just terribly ordinary, old maybe, run down certainly and definitely not attractive, but it is within walking distance from the train, bus, underground, and Marylebone High Street with its good restaurants, and lovely shops, and it is cheap for central London.

Reviews.Title: “I went back...”
Reviews.Author: hipswayno9
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the La Place over the last weekend of October 2011 as I attended a festival in Regents Park College. I really enjoyed my stay, the room (105) was a decent size, the bathroom was clean, the staff friendly and the breakfast good. If I go to the festival again next year I shall certainly book the La Place.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, excellent value, excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: stefwooduk
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hotel La Place for a girlie weekend away. We wanted a hotel thatwas near rail links and that was cost effective for three people. We hod a double and a single bed which was fine for three ladies, and the room was very spacious. The double bed was very large and extremely comfortable and the bathroom was modern and very clean. Staff were very helpful and the breakfast was fine for our purposes - scrambled egg on toast was lovely but none of us had a full english so can't comment. We were very near Baker Street tube station so felt very safe travelling as ladies at night and could get anywhere within minutes. Overall an excellent hotel where I will be returning as soon as I can get to London :)

Reviews.Title: “Well located, a bit dirty and overpriced”
Reviews.Author: Alfa222
Reviews.Content: A mixed experience. Expensive, but rather dirty. Bathroom needed fundamental esthetic improvement, which however was done upon request. They have not reduced the price in spite the fact that for three days there was a single occupancy. The "junior suite" was small and cramped. Service good, atmosphere family-like, front desk helpful. Location is the greatest advantage, but for the standard of a true "boutique hotel" some cleaning should be done.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ScottF1971
Reviews.Content: My stay in London was immensely improved by my stay at Hotel La Place; the staff were friendly and helpful, my room and all public areas were all maintained to a very high standard and considering the centrality, the rates extremely reasonable. While central, Nottingham Place is quiet and my stay was one of the most restful visits to London. Talking to other guests, I am not surprised that so many return on subsequent visits. A beautifully kept hotel, run with the visitor's interests at heart.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel La Place Review”
Reviews.Author: ElliotHolt92
Reviews.Content: i stayed at hotel la place for 2 nights on a family trip, it was terrible, they did not have lemondade at the bar, and the tiles had mold on them, what kind of a bathroom do you call that!!!!! after seeing some of the wonderful sights of london, i was very dissapointed to have payed lots of money to stay at this gastley hotel

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay unless you have to!”
Reviews.Author: AYHS
Reviews.Content: Tired decor, dusty carpets & curtains, 1970's time warp! Room so full of mismatched furniture it was hard to walk around the bed without bumping into something. Bathroom had brown stains around the sink, at the back of the bath & in the toilet-needed a litre of bleach & some elbow grease! Shower warm but very weak. One person antique lift only used twice to get bag to & from room on 3rd floor-scared of getting stuck! Dusty artificial flowers in reception. On the plus side, the sheets were clean as were most of the towels & the TV worked.

Reviews.Title: “An excuse for everything...”
Reviews.Author: JonDeBlocke
Reviews.Content: Finding an affordable hotel in London, in summer isn"t easy, but at the La Place hotel, it becomes the tired excuse for everything wrong, not working, or in dilapidated condition. Each of the desk clerks, had practiced and diverting excuses for the incredible small and dingy room "Executive Single", I was placed in. Although turn over seemed regular, it was impossible to see any other rooms, change rooms (excepted to a double suite, which will cost considerably more), or have issues addressed. The room I review, generally sums up this hotel, small, dingy, unclean (I had to wash my hands whenever I touched window handles or other areas that cleaning staff avoided in there quick daily pass through). The decor is cheap, old, poorly maintained and depressing. The worst complaint for any modern traveller, is the poor quality of the WiFi. I had to sit on the toilet to get any signal. Complaints.to management only resulted in being told it was my computer that wasn't working. In short, this hotel isn't cheap, isn't value for money, isn't clean, and isn't worth the hassle. Go elsewhere!

Reviews.Title: “A rip-off”
Reviews.Author: hutterdog
Reviews.Content: I'll start by saying that this is the first time ever that I have reviewed a hotel. Usually I think, "they were okay, so why bother, even if a few things went wrong", but this time I think, the experience was so bad, I can't not write. This hotel was a total ripoff experience for me. I booked through an agency, and there were problems with that. A long story short, I got a room at the top and the back, a tiny room with a tiny bed and a tiny shower (the wall slanted in) which would have been okay if it had been priced accordingly. What I was shocked to discover is that this tiny room with the tiny bed and the tiny shower (it is room 404, in case you want to know) was being rented out AS THE SAME PRICE AS THE REGULAR ROOMS WITH DOUBLE BEDS!!! When I pointed out the rather obvious unfairness of this arrangement, I was met with arrogance, defensiveness, and outright aggresion. I could go on and on about that: the rather tactless approach of the owner and her son, but there is no point. The point is, they are interested in getting your money, and once they have done that, they don't give a damn, because they know that you will never stay there again. See, the hotel rooms in London are so expensive and so hard to come by, that they can give really incredibly bad service and still stay in businesss. So, in my opinion, this is one to avoid.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: hipswayno9
Reviews.Content: To be fair, the price was so low I did not expect much. The building is old but well maintained. The welcome was great, the friendly receptionist looked after me, in fact everyone I spoke to was lovely. I was in room 403 which was warm, comfortable, with nice wardrobe and bathroom. The wi-fi was free. The breakfast was good. Can't really fault it and will certainly book in again. The location was perfect for me as I was at a festival in Regents Park.

Reviews.Title: “WELCOMING AND COMFORTABLE”
Reviews.Author: CanTruy
Reviews.Content: The owners made us feel so welcome and nothing was too much trouble.The situation is great near the princess Grace hospital and next door to fashionable Marleybone high St with many restaurants and boutiques.Would highly recomend this good value small hotel

Reviews.Title: “rude and ugly - avoid”
Reviews.Author: iocopocomaioco
Reviews.Content: We walked into reception to find out about room rates for our relatives - the receptionist told us it was 'unacceptable' to walk into reception with a pram and asked my wife to wait outside with it (!!!!!!).... because it made the entrance look busy and could dirty the carpet... in addition, the place looks like an old dump... very far from 'boutique' as they advertise. These people are plain rude. I won't put any relative nor friend in a place like this. Avoid.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, central location, good amenities but typical older building”
Reviews.Author: msej449
Reviews.Content: This is a private hotel in an old Edwardian building, clean and sizeable room at a competitive price, in a central location, with plenty of bars are restaurants nearby. I had double room with two very comfortable double beds, 2 comfy chairs, reasonable desk space and large opening windows and air con, looking out onto frontage. Free WiFi. Good breakfast, cooked to order. Relatively quiet road and pleasant location. Friendly staff. I can't see why you'd eat or drink-in when there are so many places to choose from within 5 minutes walk. No safe, no in-room iron/board and limited electrical sockets, very creaky floorboards. Probably not for those who prefer the standardised predictability of big chains and regular-shaped rooms. I suspect smaller rooms are rather tight. This will be about 35% cheaper than same-sized room + breakfast in a big chain in the same area, but you need to be OK with it being a more quirky older property. Personally, I'll be returning.

Reviews.Title: “If it wasn't cheap I wouldn't stay”
Reviews.Author: Eddy50
Reviews.Content: Hotel is cheap for London but you get what you pay for. The rooms are small and they need are in need desperate need of upgrading. Showers are awful - when they eventually work. Would not stay with the family. All the staff are very friendly so cannot fault them on service but they could do with someone to sort out the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “The worst 'hotel' I have ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: AdesReview
Reviews.Content: My Wife and I stayed at this pit in March of 2008 due to its location with respect to Harley Street. We were both undergoing minor surgery and were unable to drive for 24 hours after so we needed somewhere nearby to stay. Upon arrival at this place we were offered an upgrade for an extra Â£25, only we were not allowed to view the room alone and the receptionist declared she was not allowed to leave her post. We negotiated the price as we were advised that this room was double the size and a higher standard than our assigned room. The receptionist booked us in and showed us to a very small elevator, now it was ok for her to leave the reception? We were crammed into the elevator travelled one floor, left the elevator and then had to tackle two sets of small steps at the top of the stairs we could have originally came up. The room was basic with two double beds (canâ€™t remember the number) bathroom basic and smelled musty. We had various other problems, including the following. We asked for extra tea bags and milk it never arrived until the fourth time of asking. The food was disgusting, yellow greasy chips, dried grey chicken breast and browning salad, all this from an award winning chef, I donâ€™t think so. We justly complained of the morning of check out and all the duty receptionist could do was argue the toss with us, threatening that if we refused to pay they would take the money anyway using our credit card details. I have worked all over the UK and stayed in some basic hotels and B&Bâ€™s which were 5 star compared to the hotel la place, this place is very over priced, of extremely poor standard and the staff need training in customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Shocking for the money!”
Reviews.Author: perlogalism
Reviews.Content: I stayed here because it was convenient for work and there are plenty of eateries nearby. The room I had was an "executive" one and I hate to think what the normal ones are like. It's all been said before but basically for Â£100 you get a room which would cost Â£35 anywhere else in the country. It's a great shame that the owners don't spend some of their profit on maintaining the place. On the plus side, the staff are generally cheerful and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here.”
Reviews.Content: I was not shown to my room, just pointed in the right direction and told the internet was down.The room was shabby,blankets stained, and the bathroom unspeakable. The sink wouldn't drain as was choked with debris. The toilet was filthy and the bath stained with mold. I complained to the manager who made excuses. No offer of another room or reduction. I certainly did not risk the included breakfast, and checked out at 6 am.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay in room no.12!”
Reviews.Author: happy_shopper49
Reviews.Content: I see, that a previous traveller complained about this particular room, I can only agree. The room (no.12) is in desparate need of proper cleaning and doing up. The carpet and walls are really dirty. The tray for making tea and coffee and its content looks like it had not been wiped yet this year. The hotel information sheets in the drawer were very greasy to the touch. In the bathroom the ceiling was about to come down, the toilet had not been cleaned, the sink wiped with a filthy cloth, something unidentify-able had not been removed from the drain, the shower-tray was dirty and did not drain well enough when in use. The room and bathroom are tiny, but if everything else would have been alright, this would not have mattered. The sheet were clean and the furniture in good state. Maybe the other rooms are nicer.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced for what is a budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: JNH1111
Reviews.Content: I was expecting something quite special but in effect it is overpriced for what it is. Saying that the owners are very nice and helpful but the hotel looks tired and needs a decor facelift. Rooms were "OK" but not particularly well cleaned. Bathrooms are small and showers difficult to work. The finishing in the rooms left something to be desired. Beds were comfortable enough but old blankets and covers could do with cleaning more often. Small bar area and acceptable dining room. Breakfast was OK but not enough for a 15 stone bloke with a good appetite. Would I stay here again? No. I was looking for something with easy access to the West End & sights for my family but was disappointed. I'll go back to the main hotels now as they are better equipped and higher profile. I tried to do the weekend by saving a few pounds but it wasn't worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Piece of a Gem”
Reviews.Author: davidbouzas
Reviews.Content: Had a Great time. This was my first time in London. I wanted to stay in a good part of the city where I would be close to shopping and easy access to the trains. We found the Hotel La Place. We also found it to be really charming and reasonably priced. On a residental street like a good number of them are, this place just sat right with me. I had a great time meeting and talking with Hal, who runs the Hotel with his mother and that made it more desierable to know it was family owned. I was directed to some of the best shopping on Oxford Circle and adjoining neighborhoods. A place I will be returning to many times to come. db

Reviews.Title: “Le Place IS the place”
Reviews.Author: afrodog
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Le Place and was glad I did. Having stayed in several hotels across London, I was warmed by the atmosphere at Le Place: I like that it's a mother and son set up, had enough of corporate treatment! The staff were very friendly and the manager in particular (Mr Jaffer) was very helpful in advising about the local area. The room was comfortable, breakfast just right. I'll book here again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Poorvalue”
Reviews.Author: clottieYorkshire
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for two nights in June having booked on-line and seen the pictures of the splendid spacious rooms. I was shown to a very dark , very small and dingy room in a rear extension (number 12). I refused this room and was offered another only with bad grace (we are very busy you know, we have no spare rooms, we have turned away several people already). If I had not been very tired I would have gone somewhere else. The room I was offered when I stood my ground was on the fourth floor - the lift goes only to the third - and was equally small but at least had a window giving some natural light. The web site advertises single rooms as having double beds. What is the reason for that? With a single bed the room would have been just about OK for size, having a double bed meant edging around the bed all the time to get anywhere. For two people it would have been difficult to move about the room. The fittings were tired at best, the carpet very worn, the walls needed painting as fittings had clearly been moved recently and left dirty patches on the wall and the nail holes roughly filled, the door fittings had been changed and taped over, part of the curtain fitting had become detached from the wall etc. These seem like small things but taken all together with the others I have not listed the effect was off putting. My main disappointment was that this was going to cost Â£99.00 per night! The price is not justified even though it is an expensive part of town - as I was repeatedly reminded during my stay. Having said all that there were some good points: there was a new air conditioning unit, the shower was good, there was a large flat screen TV, the location is good. Apart from the one person who seemed to think I should be grateful to stay there, the people who worked there were very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “disappointing 'boutique' hotel. Not good value for money”
Reviews.Author: aquila.ann
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night in June 2008 and thought it very expensive for the quality offered. Our room did have a huge bed but the room was small and therefore cramped. The furniture was chipped and shabby. The bathroom was small and it was very difficult to reach the bath taps around the bath screen. The water was not particularly hot. The public hall and stairs were tired looking. The breakfast very basic. No fruit, only orange juice offered, the full breakfast was only one small sausage, two small bits of bacon and egg and mushroom. It looked quite a mean ration on the plate for the amount we were paying for the room! We had to keep asking the girl for more coffee - we didn't even get our own pot. It felt like we were paying through the nose and may as well have gone to any cheap B & B. I could not see what they got their 'silver ' award for. The croissants were good though and they were always helpful at the front desk. But I want more than that for Â£70 a night each!!

Reviews.Title: “Tired La Place”
Reviews.Author: pellisee
Reviews.Content: Spent 2 nights in a Suite at LaPlace and were disappointed in the overall condition of the hotel and rooms. The Suite on their website looked spacious and inviting, but was disappointing. The lobby/reception area was painted "Pepto" pink. Touted as a boutique hotel, this hotel needs a lot of work. The restaurant is only open several nights a week. A little bar area served VERY expensive cocktails. Check the price before you order. Hal, the owner, was very congenial and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely little hotel in the middle of the city”
Reviews.Author: sweetpants
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here for one night for our anniversary and found it to be a beautiful and welcoming establishment. We contacted the hotel directly by email and following a very prompt response from the manager we booked it very easily. The location is easy walking distance from Baker Street tube station, even with luggage. Check-in was friendly and efficient and the room was clean and had an English charm that wouldn't be found in any bigger chain hotels. The bathroom was modern and clean and the size of the room was cosy but not tight...there was plenty of space for our things and for us to get ready for a night out. The central location was excellent for going out in to town and walking back (from Regents Street) but we were suprised how quiet it was inside considering it is about 200m from the busy Marylebone Road. Its setting in the quiet neighbourhood of Marylebone Village is a stark contrast to the bustle and noise of Oxford Street and we wish we had had more time to explore the little cafes and shops in the area. The morning breakfast was a bonus that you would normally have to pay for in most other places and it was served with a smile. We noted that in the hallway there was a noticeboard covered with messages and postcards from many a satisfied guest and we would agree with their enthusiasm. We would definately stay at Hotel La Place again and recommend it to family and friends.

Reviews.Title: “What A Surprise”
Reviews.Author: CityTony
Reviews.Content: What a surprise it is to find a hotel that "has it all". The staff was extremely nice and welcoming. In addition, many of the staff members speak multiple languages. The rooms were very well decorated and extremely well maintained. The location was very convenient to all the "hot spots" in London. The service was amazing and beyond our expectation. There is no doubt that I will stay here when I am in London again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved our stay”
Reviews.Author: BlessedFlorida
Reviews.Content: We had a fantastic time when we stayed there in April. The owner and his family was very helpful, going out of his way to suggest places to visit, good restaurants etc. We would certainly go back as it is so well placed, very close to Baker St. with some traditional English pubs near by. Looking forward to coming back!

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotel in London”
Reviews.Author: kennyspain
Reviews.Content: One of the best hotel in London, wish their was more A small family run hotel very nice people, make you feel very at home The hotel is spotless, food is very good , the staff are friendly, helpful and honest, Kenneth N.O'Flynn U.K. Marketing Supervisor MRI Overseas Property

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel La Place
HotelInfo.Address: 17 Nottingham Place, London W1U 5LG, England
